intro: Serratula boetica subsp. alcalae, commonly known as the Alcalá thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are serrated and covered in fine hairs, and it produces a milky sap that contains alkaloids. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological adaptations and chemical composition.
